TEXT.English: Cloth Dyer (Logwood):Cloth Dyers (Logwood)
Cloth Dyer (Cochineal):Cloth Dyers (Cochineal)
Wool Dyer (Logwood):Wool Dyers (Logwood)
Wool Dyer (Cochineal):Wool Dyers (Cochineal)

Fowling is hunting birds for meat, feathers or any other commercially valuable products. In the north, down feathers from eider duck can be collected for eiderdowns and quilted jackets without necessarily killing the birds.[NEWLINE]From the 17th up to the late 19th century shotguns were loaded through the muzzle with black powder and lead shot, until percussion lock firearms and breech loading guns became popular. In Europe every landowner's estate needed a gamekeeper.

Forest tiles can yield [LINK=YIELD_BIRDS]birds[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bird hunter[COLOR_REVERT] profession. The birds in your game bag can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_BIRD_HUNTER]expert bird hunter[\LINK] to the job.

Wildfowling is the historic name for hunting waterfowl. Decoys and shotguns are the main tools needed. Hunters also use a variety of dogs, from pointers to retrievers.[NEWLINE]In the Western Isles of Scotland, hunters called gillies take seabirds from their nests on cliffs.[NEWLINE]The most efficient fowler is the punt gunner. He has a long, small-bore muzzle-loaded cannon, mounted centre-forward in a specially designed boat like a heavy wooden kayak. The fowler lies in the after half with paddle blades strapped to his forearms, getting close to a raft of ducks. After a single massive cannon blast, all that's needed is to gather up the harvest and get it to market.

Shoreline and water tiles can yield [LINK=YIELD_SEA_BIRDS]seabirds[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]sea bird hunter[COLOR_REVERT] profession. The birds in your game bag can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_SEA_BIRD_HUNTER]expert sea bird hunter[\LINK] to the job.

Bloodwood is a versatile dye, used for both textiles and paper. It can also be used as a pH indicator, yellow-reddish under acidic conditions and purple when alkaline. The bark and leaves are also used in various medical applications.[NEWLINE]Bloodwood played an important role in the lives of 17th-century buccaneers during the Golden Age of Piracy. Bloodwood cutters often had their output seized by Spanish ships, so they joined pirate crews to raid the Spanish and get their wood back.

Jungle tiles can yield [LINK=YIELD_BLOODWOOD]bloodwood[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bloodwood cutter[COLOR_REVERT] profession. Bloodwood production can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_BLOODWOOD_CUTTER]expert bloodwood cutter[\LINK] to the job.

Hardwood is found in broad-leaved temperate and tropical forests. Tropical hardwoods like mahogany are valued for furniture. Teak, while not native to the Americas, can be grown in the Caribbean and is important in shipbuilding.[NEWLINE]Hardwood is used for fuel, tools, construction, boat building, furniture making, musical instruments, flooring, cooking, barrels, and manufacture of charcoal. The density adds to durability, appearance, and performance. Solid hardwood joinery is expensive compared to softwood.

Jungle and forest tiles can yield [LINK=YIELD_HARDWOOD]hardwood[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]hardwood lumberjack[COLOR_REVERT] profession. Hardwood production can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_LUMBERJACK]expert hardwood lumberjack[\LINK] to the job.

Goats will eat vegetation that most other domesticated livestock decline, so they can subsist on very poor land. Unprocessed goat milk has small, well-emulsified fat globules, which means the cream remains suspended in the milk instead of rising to the top, as in unprocessed cow milk; therefore, it does not need to be homogenized.[NEWLINE]The number of animals that a goat farmer can sustain depends on the quality of the pasture. A poor man with poor land can still raise goats.[NEWLINE]Perhaps because of their adaptability, goats have become a symbol of evil. Witches are said to cavort with goats. Satan has goat horns.

Plains tiles let you raise [LINK=YIELD_GOATS]goats[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]goatherd[COLOR_REVERT] profession. Goat herds can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_GOATHERD]expert goatherd[\LINK] to the job.

Historically a few pigs would be kept near the owner's residence, or in the same village or town. There are many ways of farming pigs: intensive commercial units, commercial free range enterprises, or simply letting them wander around. They can be tethered in a simple shelter or kept in a pen outside the owner's house.[NEWLINE]Pigs are raised for food and skins. They're valued for their ability to convert inedible food into meat and manure, and can be fed household food waste. On a large scale pigs are one way to dispose of municipal garbage.

Plains tiles let you raise [LINK=YIELD_PIGS]pigs[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]pig breeder[COLOR_REVERT] profession. Pig production can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_PIG_BREEDER]expert pig breeder[\LINK] to the job.

Free-range poultry farming allows chickens to roam during the day, although they are usually confined in coops at night to protect them from predators. They're also kept indoors when the weather is bad.[NEWLINE]Hens begin laying eggs at 16–21 weeks of age, although production starts declining after 25 weeks of age. Since the egg economics no longer make sense, chickens are slaughtered after approximately 12 months of egg production.

Plains tiles let you raise [LINK=YIELD_CHICKENS]chickens[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]chicken breeder[COLOR_REVERT] profession. Chicken production can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_CHICKEN_BREEDER]expert chicken breeder[\LINK] to the job.

Geese are the fastest growers among domestic birds. They're hardy and disease free when given constant care. Geese can be brought up on green pasture, which lowers production cost substantially. [NEWLINE]Among waterfowl goose breeds are grouped into heavy, medium and light classes. Geese are bred for meat, foie gras and occasionally for speciality eggs. They are also charming and intelligent pets, useful guard dogs, and efficient lawn mowers.[NEWLINE]Each breeding goose needs 200 grams of grain and 100 grams of vegetables per day. To know when geese are mating, remove one female from the pen and see how the gander reacts. During breeding season geese, both the goose and ganders, will become aggressive toward people, dogs and cats.

Plains tiles let you raise [LINK=YIELD_GEESE]geese[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]goose breeder[COLOR_REVERT] profession. Goose production can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_GEESE_BREEDER]expert goose breeder[\LINK] to the job.

Because fruit varieties mature at different times throughout the season, fruit pickers are often migrant, moving among the orchards and farms as needed. In the tropics fruit grows year-round.[NEWLINE]Bananas are the world's most popular fruit. Apples are common in temperate zones, and some berries grow in the taiga or tundra.[NEWLINE]Having fresh fruit is one of the biggest factors moving a community from barely surviving into robust good health. Big orchards and industrial farms are restricted to tropical and temperate zones, but berries are an important vitamin source in cold climates.

Plains tiles let you grow [LINK=YIELD_FRUITS]fruit[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]fruit picker[COLOR_REVERT] profession. Fruit harvests can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_FRUITS_PICKER]expert fruit picker[\LINK] to the job.

Rice has been grown for at least 7,000 years. It's unusual among grains in that almost all rice is eaten by humans, though bran left after milling is used as livestock feed. Most rice is grown on submerged land in the coastal plains, tidal deltas, and river basins of tropical, semitropical, and temperate regions.[NEWLINE]Growing rice takes 40 continuous days above 21 degrees (70 F). It's normally grown as an annual plant, although in tropical areas it can survive as a perennial, producing a crop for up to 30 years. When dried it offers high food value for the weight, so it's a favourite food for seasoned scouts.

Plains tiles let you grow [LINK=YIELD_RICE]rice[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]rice farmer[COLOR_REVERT] profession. The rice harvest can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_RICE_FARMER]expert rice farmer[\LINK] to the job.

Cassava is a prime carbohydrate source in the tropics, outranked only by rice and corn. It's classified as sweet or bitter. Bitter varieties contain more antinutrients.[NEWLINE]For example, improper preparation of cassava can leave enough residual cyanide to cause acute cyanide intoxication, and even death.[NEWLINE]The cassava root can be boiled. Tapioca, which is cassava starch, can be extracted and used for everything from desserts to an animal feed supplement. Cassava is particularly high in vitamin C.

Jungle tiles let you grow [LINK=YIELD_CASSAVA]cassava[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cassava planter[COLOR_REVERT] profession. The cassava harvest can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_CASSAVA_PLANTER]expert cassava planter[\LINK] to the job.

Flax is cultivated for food and fibre. Flax textiles are known as linen. The edible oil is high in omega-3 fatty acids, important for heart health.[NEWLINE]Soils most suitable for flax are alluvial or deep loams with a lot of organic matter. Flax is often found growing just above the waterline in cranberry bogs.[NEWLINE]Flax seeds produce a vegetable oil known as flax seed oil or linseed oil, which is one of the oldest commercial oils. It is an edible oil obtained by expeller pressing and sometimes followed by solvent extraction. Solvent-processed flax seed oil has been used for many centuries as a drying oil in painting and varnishing.

Shoreline tiles let you grow [LINK=YIELD_FLAX]flax[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]flax planter[COLOR_REVERT] profession. The flax harvest can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_FLAX_PLANTER]expert flax planter[\LINK] to the job.

Rapeseed with its bright yellow flowers is cultivated mainly for its oil-rich seed, which has appreciable amounts of erucic acid. Rapeseed meal, left after the oil is extracted, is a high-protein animal feed.[NEWLINE]Rapeseed is a valuable oil crop. Once the oil is extracted, what's left is used as fodder for domestic animals, mainly cattle, but also pigs and poultry. It's a member of the cabbage family.

Plains tiles let you grow [LINK=YIELD_RAPE]rapeseed[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]rapeseed planter[COLOR_REVERT] profession. The rapeseed harvest can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_RAPE_PLANTER]expert rapeseed planter[\LINK] to the job.

Olive trees will have either table olives or olives for oil. Spanish colonists brought the olive to the New World in 1560, where its cultivation prospered in present-day Peru, Chile, and Argentina. In the 18th century Spanish missionaries planted olive trees in California. Because wild game is so lean, especially on the frontier cooking oils are important for good health.[NEWLINE]Before European contact cooking oil was essential for Pacific Northwest Native nations. Candlefish oil was so central to Native commerce that the trade routes were called grease trails.

Plains tiles let you grow [LINK=YIELD_OLIVES]olives[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]olive planter[COLOR_REVERT] profession. The olive harvest can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_OLIVES_PLANTER]expert olive planter[\LINK] to the job.

The Guaraní and Tupí cultivated yerba mate prior to European colonization. After the Jesuits started using it, yerba mate became widespread in what's now Paraguay and throughout other Spanish colonies. Yerba leaves are steeped in hot water to make a caffeinated beverage: yerba mate. Brewed cold, it is used to make tereré.[NEWLINE]When assigned to the yerba planter profession, the expert can get twice as many yerba leaves in the same time as a regular colonist.

Jungle tiles let you grow [LINK=YIELD_YERBA]yerba mate[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT] yerba collector[COLOR_REVERT] profession. The yerba harvest can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_YERBA_COLLECTOR]expert yerba collector[\LINK] to the job.

Vanilla is one of the two most popular flavours for sweet treats, the other being chocolate. It's used in candy, baking and liqueurs, all of which would be familiar to monks in colonial missions.[NEWLINE]Vanilla is a spice derived from orchids. There are three major species, all derived from the original Mexican plant. It can be pollinated by hand to produce the vanilla bean.

Jungle tiles let you gather [LINK=YIELD_VANILLA]vanilla[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT] vanilla collector[COLOR_REVERT] profession. The vanilla harvest can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_VANILLA_COLLECTOR]expert vanilla collector[\LINK] to the job.

The cochineal insects found on prickly pear cactus pads produce carminic acid, a predator-deterring chemical. When mixed with aluminum or calcium salts cochineal becomes carmine dye. Collectors gather the bugs by brushing them off the cactus pads.[NEWLINE]Bright red carmine dye, used in the Americas for colouring fabrics, became an important export good in the 16th century.[NEWLINE]Cochineal insects are found in the areas now known as Peru, Mexico, Chile and Argentina.

Desert tiles let you gather [LINK=YIELD_COCHINEAL]cochineal[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT] cochineal collector[COLOR_REVERT] profession. The cochineal harvest can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_COCHINEAL_COLLECTOR]expert cochineal collector[\LINK] to the job.

Peanuts are widely grown in the tropics and subtropics. Botanically they're a member of the bean family but in cooking they're used like a nut. Unlike most legumes peanut pods mature underground.[NEWLINE]Boiled peanuts are a popular snack in the areas where they're grown. They can be used to treat malnutrition and are especially important for feeding slave populations.[NEWLINE]Peanuts are usually roasted before being shipped.

Plains tiles let you grow [LINK=YIELD_PEANUTS]peanuts[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT] peanut planter[COLOR_REVERT] profession. The peanut harvest can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_PEANUT_PLANTER]expert peanut planter[\LINK] to the job.

Rubber is harvested by making incisions in the bark of rubber trees. The latex is heated to create rubber that can be dried into waterproof sheets before further processing. Rubber has a large stretch ratio, high resilience and is also waterproof. It's classified as an elastomer.

Jungle tiles let you gather [LINK=YIELD_KAUTSCHUK]rubber[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT] rubber collector[COLOR_REVERT] profession. Rubber production can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_KAUTSCHUK_COLLECTOR]expert rubber collector[\LINK] to the job.

In spring when sap starts to flow in the maple forests, tappers hammer spouts through the bark and collect a thin fluid that's then distilled over a slow fire into a rich thick syrup. It can also be poured on snow to make maple sugar.[NEWLINE]Maple syrup comes from maple forests which grow in north temperate regions. It's a popular treat, contributing to happiness.

Forest tiles let you gather [LINK=YIELD_MAPLE_SIRUP]maple syrup[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT] maple syrup collector[COLOR_REVERT] profession. Maple syrup production can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_MAPLE_SIRUP_COLLECTOR]expert maple syrup collector[\LINK] to the job.

Peat is a peasant fuel, warming the poor and slaves at low or no cost. Peat is the world's most efficient carbon sink, storing 42% of all soil carbon, more than all other vegetation types, including the world's forests. It's not renewable.[NEWLINE]A swamp dries and very slowly turns into a peat bog, which offers cheap fuel where wood and coal aren't available. Peat cutters don't need much equipment to do their work, just a cutter and a hod to carry chunks of peat on their backs.

Bog tiles let you gather [LINK=YIELD_PEAT]peat[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT] peat cutter[COLOR_REVERT] profession. Peat production can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_PEAT_CUTTER]expert peat cutter[\LINK] to the job.

Clay develops plasticity when wet, due to a molecular film of water surrounding the clay particles, but becomes hard, brittle and non–plastic upon drying or firing. Shale, formed largely from clay, is the most common sedimentary rock.[NEWLINE]Clay is the oldest known ceramic material. Prehistoric humans used it for making pottery. Early pottery shards have been dated to 14,000 BC, and clay tablets are the first known writing medium.

Mountain and hill tiles let you gather [LINK=YIELD_CLAY]clay[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT] clay miner[COLOR_REVERT] profession. Clay production can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_MINER]expert clay miner[\LINK] to the job.

Coal is formed when dead plant matter decays into peat and is converted into coal by the heat and pressure of deep burial over millions of years. During colonial times coal is used for heating, not for industry. Coal mining causes premature death and illness, but it's a soft rock that doesn't need as many explosives as hard rock mining. It's a job where labourers use picks and shovels, and they don't get paid much.

Mountain and hill tiles let you gather [LINK=YIELD_COAL]coal[\LINK] if the colonist working them is assigned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT] coal miner[COLOR_REVERT] profession. Coal production can be increased by assigning an [LINK=UNIT_MINER]expert coal miner[\LINK] to the job.

Yerba leaves are steeped in hot water to make a caffeinated beverage: yerba mate. Brewed cold, it is used to make terere.[NEWLINE]The Guarani and Tupi cultivated yerba mate prior to European colonization. After the Jesuits started using it, yerba mate became widespread in what's now Paraguay and throughout other Spanish colonies.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Yerba traders[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_YERBA_TRADERS_HOUSE]yerba trader's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_YERBA]yerba tea[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_YERBA]yerba[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_YERBA_MAKER]Master yerba traders[\LINK] excel at this craft, and can greatly boost your production of yerba mate.

Whisky was in the baggage of many Scottish immigrants who wanted something similar in their new home. Malted barley was the main ingredient in Europe but it was never as successful in the New World.[NEWLINE]Corn whiskey, later called bourbon, became the American standard. Commercial distilleries also began to make whiskey from wheat and rye starting in the late 18th century.[NEWLINE]During the Civil War excise taxes were introduced. That led to moonshine, high-proof liquor made illegally at night in the woods, especially in the American South.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Whiskey distillers[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_DISTILLERS_HOUSE]distiller's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_HOOCH]whiskey[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_CORN]corn[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_DISTILLER]Master whiskey distillers[\LINK] excel at this craft, and can greatly boost your production of whiskey.

Rugged wooden furniture is all well and good for settlers out on the frontier, but citizens who've earned a little comfort appreciate an easy chair and a big soft couch to sink into. They'll pay extra for that pleasure, which is why the upholsterer has chosen a good trade.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Upholsterers[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_FURNITURE_MAKERS_HOUSE]furniture maker's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_PADDED_FURNITURE]padded furniture[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_LEATHER]leather[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_FURNITURE_MAKER]Master upholsterers[\LINK] excel at this craft, and can greatly boost your production of padded furniture.
Tanner (Pig Skins):Tanners (Pig Skins)

Pigskin is softer than cow leather and is preferred for detailed items such as gloves. Pigskin jackets are more supple than the heavier cow leather jacket, which however is more durable. Pig leather is easier to work, so garments typically have a finer finish.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pigskin tanners[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_TANNERS_HOUSE]tanner's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_PIG_SKINS]pigskins[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_PIGS]pigs[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_TANNER_PIG]Master pigskin tanners[\LINK] excel at this craft, and can greatly boost your production of pigskin.
Potter:Potters

Pottery is an ancient way to store grain. Early pottery shards have been dated to 14,000 BC.[NEWLINE]In the rainy insect-ridden New World pots hold enough grain to keep settlers alive through the winter until in the spring when they can finally plant their new crops.[NEWLINE]Clay for pottery develops plasticity when wet, due to a molecular film of water surrounding the clay particles, but becomes hard, brittle and non–plastic upon drying or firing.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Potters[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_POTTERS_HOUSE]potter's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_POTTERY]pottery[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_CLAY]clay[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_POTTER]Master potters[\LINK] excel at this craft, and can greatly boost your production of pottery.
Field Worker Tools Trader:Field Worker Tools Traders
Field workers can be hard on their tools. Axes get dull, shovels bend and hammer heads fly off the handle. A good tool supplier will get the necessary equipment to where the workers need it.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fieldworker tools traders[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_VILLAGE_MARKET]village market[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to sell [LINK=YIELD_FIELD_WORKER_TOOLS]fieldworker tools[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_FIELD_WORKER_TOOLS_TRADER]Master fieldworker tools traders[\LINK] excel at this craft, and can greatly boost your sales of fieldworker tools.
Household Goods Trader:Household Goods Traders
The household goods trader operates a general store where food, clothing and household necessities are available for purchase.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Household goods traders[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_VILLAGE_MARKET]village market[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to sell [LINK=YIELD_HOUSEHOLD_GOODS]household goods[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_HOUSEHOLD_GOODS_TRADER]Master household goods traders[\LINK] excel at this craft, and can greatly boost your sales of household goods.
Peanut Roaster:Peanut Roasters

The peanut is a legume grown mainly for its edible seeds. It's widely grown in the tropics and subtropics. The peanut is valuable both as a grain legume and, due to its high oil content, as an oil crop. Cultivation was well-established in the Americas before the Spanish arrived.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Peanut roasters[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_ROASTER_HOUSE]roaster's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_FIELD_WORKER_TOOLS]roast peanuts[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_ORE]peanuts[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_POTTER]Master peanut roasters[\LINK] excel at this craft, and can greatly boost your production of roast peanuts.

The goat is one of the oldest domesticated animals. Archaeological evidence shows it domesticated in Iran 10,000 years ago. Goats are used for milk, meat, fur, and skins across much of the world. Unprocessed goat milk has small, well-emulsified fat globules, which means the cream remains suspended in the milk instead of rising to the top, as in unprocessed cow milk; therefore, it does not need to be homogenized.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Goat butchers[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_BUTCHERS_HOUSE]butcher's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_FIELD_GOAT_MEAT]goat meat[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_GOATS]goats[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_BUTCHER]Master goat butchers[\LINK] excel at this craft, and can greatly boost your production of goat meat.
Hog farming means breeding domestic pigs, a branch of animal husbandry. Pigs are raised for food and skins.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pig butchers[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_BUTCHERS_HOUSE]butcher's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_FIELD_PIG_MEAT]pork[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_FIELD_PIG_LEATHER]pigskin[\LINK]from [LINK=YIELD_PIGS]pigs[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_BUTCHER]Master pig butchers[\LINK] excel at this craft, and can greatly boost your production of pig meat.

Free-range poultry farming allows chickens to roam during the day, although they are usually confined in coops at night to protect them from predators. They're also kept indoors when the weather is bad.[NEWLINE]Hens begin laying eggs at 16–21 weeks of age, although production starts declining after 25 weeks of age. Since eggs no longer make economic sense, chickens are slaughtered after 12 months of egg production.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Chicken butchers[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_BUTCHERS_HOUSE]butcher's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_FIELD_CHICKEN_MEAT]chicken meat[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_CHICKENS]chickens[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_BUTCHER]Master chicken butchers[\LINK] excel at this craft, and can greatly boost your production of chicken meat.
Geese are the fastest growers among domestic birds. They're hardy and disease free when given constant care. Geese can be brought up on green pasture, which lowers production cost substantially.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Goose butchers[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_BUTCHERS_HOUSE]butcher's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_FIELD_GOOSE_MEAT]goose meat[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_FIELD_DOWNS]goose down[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_GEESE]geese[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_BUTCHER]Master goose butchers[\LINK] excel at this craft. They dramatically boost your production of goose meat and down.

Milkmaids work hard to deliver much-needed protein to settlers young and old. Anyone who thinks the work is easy hasn't been close enough to the business end of a cow.[NEWLINE]Milkmaids are also immune to smallpox, a rare advantage in colonial times.[NEWLINE]Milk as a business most often means the milk of cows. It's a good source of protein and fat. When used to make cheese, milk is acidified and the enzymes of either rennet or other bacteria are added to cause the casein to coagulate.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Milkmaids[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_RANCHERS_HOUSE]rancher's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce dairy cow [LINK=YIELD_FIELD_MILK]milk[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_MILKMAID_CATTLE]Expert milkmaids[\LINK] excel at this craft. They dramatically boost your production of cow milk.
Sheep milk has more protein and fat, and larger casein particles than cow or goat milk. It's nutritious, and a source of distinctive cheeses.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Milkmaids[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_RANCHERS_HOUSE]rancher's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce sheep [LINK=YIELD_FIELD_MILK]milk[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_MILKMAID_SHEEP]Expert milkmaids[\LINK] excel at this craft. They dramatically boost your production of sheep milk.

Unprocessed goat milk has small, well-emulsified fat globules, which means the cream remains suspended in the milk instead of rising to the top, as in unprocessed cow milk; therefore, it does not need to be homogenized.[NEWLINE]The number of animals that a goat farmer can sustain depends on the quality of the pasture.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Milkmaids[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_RANCHERS_HOUSE]rancher's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce goat[LINK=YIELD_FIELD_MILK]milk[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_MILKMAID_GOATS]Expert milkmaids[\LINK] excel at this craft. They dramatically boost your production of goat milk.

Cheese is produced in a wide range of flavours and textures by coagulation of the milk protein casein. It's made up of proteins and fat, usually from the milk of cows, goats, or sheep. During production, milk is acidified and the enzymes of either rennet or other bacterial enzymes are added to cause the casein to coagulate. The solid curds are then separated from the liquid whey and pressed into finished cheese.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cheesemakers[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_CHEESE_MAKERS_HOUSE]cheesemaker's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_FIELD_CHEESE]cheese[\LINK] from [LINK=YIELD_FIELD_MILK]milk[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_BUTCHER]Master cheesemakers[\LINK] excel at this craft. They dramatically boost your production of cheese.

During the Middle Ages farmers used rapeseed in crop rotation to keep weeds down and improve the soil. Rapeseed oil was rarely eaten by humans. The old strains were horribly bitter and contained high levels of toxic erucic acid. For centuries the oil was used in animal feed.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rapeseed oil traders[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_OIL_TRADER_HOUSE]oil trader's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_FIELD_RAPE_OIL]rapeseed oil[\LINK] . [LINK=UNIT_RAPE_OIL_TRADER]Master rapeseed oil traders[\LINK] excel at this craft. They dramatically boost your production of rapeseed oil.
Pressing oil is an ancient craft in Europe, particularly in Mediterranean cultures. Equipment that crushes olives for their oil can be adapted to work with rapeseed.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Olive oil traders[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_OIL_TRADER_HOUSE]oil trader's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_FIELD_OLIVE_OIL]olive oil[\LINK] . [LINK=UNIT_OLIVE_OIL_TRADER]Master olive oil traders[\LINK] excel at this craft. They dramatically boost your production of olive oil.

The tailor creates the well-dressed man, stylish and ready to succeed at diplomacy, business and romance. The tailor's shop includes sub-trades. The cutter seldom sews the garment. Another chooses the perfect fabric. In a growing town with a fashionable tailor, everyone from the merchant to the blacksmith buys there to look their best.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Formal wear tailors[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_TAYLORS_HOUSE]tailor's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_FESTIVE_CLOTHES]clothing for festive events[\LINK] . [LINK=UNIT_CLOTH_TAILOR]Master formal wear tailors[\LINK] excel at this craft. They dramatically boost your production of stylish clothing for special occasions.
The tailor has to know how to provide durable clothing at a good price. In a growing town the tailor must be efficient and also diplomatic, because everyone wants to feel that they look good.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Workwear tailors[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_TAYLORS_HOUSE]tailor's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_EVERYDAY_CLOTHES]clothing for everyday life[\LINK] . [LINK=UNIT_CLOTH_TAILOR]Master workwear tailors[\LINK] excel at this craft. They dramatically boost your production of practical clothing for day-to-day living.

A confectioner turns plantation sugar into a high-value product by flavouring it - perhaps with chocolate or vanilla. It's important to grind the sugar fine so that the candy has a smooth consistency.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Chocolatiers[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_CONFECTIONERS_HOUSE]confectioner's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_CHOCOLATE]a variety of chocolates[\LINK] . [LINK=UNIT_CONFECTIONER]Master chocolatiers[\LINK] excel at this craft. They dramatically boost your production of chocolates.

A confectioner turns plantation sugar into a high-value product by flavouring it - perhaps with chocolate or vanilla. It's important to grind the sugar fine so that the candy has a smooth consistency.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Confectioners[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_CONFECTIONERS_HOUSE]confectioner's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_CHOCOLATE]vanilla treats[\LINK] . [LINK=UNIT_CONFECTIONER]Master chocolatiers[\LINK] excel at this craft. They dramatically boost your production of vanilla cakes and candies.
Sewing padding and a lining into leather doesn't just make the garment more comfortable. By adding insulation it also improves health for those working outside, and can even save their lives.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Leather tailors[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_TAYLORS_HOUSE]tailor's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_PADDED_COATS]padded coats[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_LEATHER_TAILOR]Master leather tailors[\LINK] excel at this craft. They dramatically boost your production of coats with linings.

English.Text: Leather Padder (Goat Hide Boots):Leather Padders (Goat Hide Boots)

TEXT.English: Sewing a lining into boots is a big help in cold weather. Anyone working outside will be more comfortable, and that means they can work longer.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Leather tailors[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_TAYLORS_HOUSE]tailor's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_PADDED_BOOTS]leather boots with linings[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_LEATHER_TAILOR]Master leather tailors[\LINK] excel at this craft. They dramatically boost your production of leather boots.

The charcoal burner watches the smoke exiting the kiln. If the smoke is thick and grey, the wood is still raw; thin, blue smoke indicates good carbonization. Charcoal comes from wood cooked in a kiln over six to eight days, sometimes longer. Charcoal burns at 1,100 degrees Celsius. The melting point of iron is 1,200 degrees.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Charcoal burners[COLOR_REVERT] can produce [LINK=YIELD_CHARCOAL]charcoal[\LINK] on forest tiles. [LINK=UNIT_CHARCOAL_BURNER]Expert charcoal burners[\LINK] excel at this craft. They dramatically boost your production of charcoal.

Well away from other buildings the powder maker mixes gunpowder from sulphur, charcoal and saltpeter: ammunition for the soldiers' guns. In colonial times it's the only available explosive (dynamite will be invented in 1867) so it's also used for artillery, mining and road building.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Powder makers[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_FIREWORKERS_HOUSE]powder magazine[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_GUNPOWDER]gunpowder[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_FIREWORKER]Master powder makers[\LINK] excel at this craft. They dramatically boost your production of gunpowder.

Humans are social animals, Fame brings people together to be entertained, to see and be seen. A celebrity performance attracts the entire countryside. To have a resident famous actress improves any community's reputation. Leaving a trail of broken hearts behind her, her legend grows.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Entertainers[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_TAVERN]tavern[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_HAPPINESS]happiness[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_CULTURE]culture[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_ENTERTAINER]Expert entertainers[\LINK] excel at this craft. Along with a little happiness they dramatically boost your production of culture.

Church-going ladies may look down on an honest whore but harlots often have influence with the high and mighty, including those in the church. Prostitution is as diverse as society itself. The seductive harlot might have a lucrative career but it's short. Some who like the life go into management after their peak personal earning years.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Prostitutes[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_TAVERN]tavern[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_HAPPINESS]happiness[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_CULTURE]culture[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_PROSTITUTE]Expert prostitutes[\LINK] excel at this craft. Along with a little culture they dramatically boost your production of happiness.

The baker starts work well before dawn so that households can have their daily bread. As the bakery grows, offering cookies and pastries, it becomes a social center. Some bakers even set up tables where tea is served to accompany the treats.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bakers[COLOR_REVERT] can work in the [LINK=BUILDING_BAKERS_HOUSE]baker's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_BAKERY_GOODS]bakery goods[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_DISTILLER]Master bakers[\LINK] excel at this craft, and can greatly boost your production of fresh baking.

A judge presides over court proceedings, hears all the witnesses and any other evidence presented by the barristers or solicitors of the case, assesses the credibility and arguments of the parties, and then issues a ruling in the case based on their interpretation of the law and their own personal judgment. A judge is expected to conduct the trial impartially in an open court.

[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Judges[COLOR_REVERT] work in the [LINK=BUILDING_COURTHOUSE]courthouse[\LINK] or one of its upgrades to produce [LINK=YIELD_LAW]law[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_JUDGE]Honourable judges[\LINK] excel at this craft. They dramatically boost your production of law.
